Algorithms.Heaps.Python package¶

Submodules¶

Algorithms.Heaps.Python.binary_heap module¶

class Algorithms.Heaps.Python.binary_heap.BinaryHeap[source]¶

Bases: object

insert(key, data=None)[source]¶

Inserts a node into the heap.

Args:
key: The key of the node to insert. This determines in what
order the nodes will be popped.
data: The value of the node to insert into the heap. If left
blank the data will be equal to the key.
pop()[source]¶

Pops the minimum node off the heap.

Returns:
The minimum node in the heap.

Algorithms.Heaps.Python.fibonacci_heap module¶

class Algorithms.Heaps.Python.fibonacci_heap.FibonacciHeap[source]¶

Bases: object

NOTE: this implements a minimum heap where the minimum
always at the top.
decrease_key(node, new_key)[source]¶

Decreases the key of the specified node.

Args:

node (HeapNode): The node to decrease the key of.

new_key: The new key of the node. This must be less than the current
key of the node and comparable to other keys used in the heap.
delete(node)[source]¶

Deletes the node from the heap.

Args:
node (HeapNode): What node to delete.
Returns:
The deleted node.
static heapify(arr)[source]¶

Turns an iterable data structure into a heap.

Args:
arr: The list/array/etc that you want to create a heap with.
Returns:
A heap with the elements from the list/array/etc.
insert(key, data=None)[source]¶

Creates a new node and inserts it into the heap.

Args:
key: A comparable value representing the priority of the
new node.
data: The data of the new node. If left blank the data is
set to equal the key.
Returns:
The newly created node.
merge(other)[source]¶

Merges two heaps.

Args:
other (FibonacciHeap): Heap to merge with self
Returns:
The new, merged, heap.
peek()[source]¶

Returns the top node in the heap.

pop()[source]¶

Takes the top node off the heap and consolidates. (Also called delete minimum or extract minimum)

Returns:
Node with the minimum key
